passage_text: Medical Definition of XENOPHOBIA. : fear and hatred of strangers or foreigners or of anything that is strange or foreign. Full Definition of XENOPHOBIA. : fear and hatred of strangers or foreigners or of anything that is strange or foreign. See xenophobia defined for English-language learners. See xenophobia defined for kids

Antonyms for xenophobia. 1  fairness. 2  good will. 3  impartiality. 4  happiness. 5  admiration. 6  fondness. 7  liking. 8  tolerance. 9  love. 10  like. 11  pleasure. 12  esteem. 13  loving. 14  respect. 15  approval. 16  sympathy. 17  justice. 18  regard.
xen·o·phobe. n. A person who is fearful or contemptuous of that which is foreign, especially of strangers or of people from different countries or cultures. xen′o·pho′bi·a n. xen′o·pho′bic adj.
xen·o·phobe. n. A person who is fearful or contemptuous of that which is foreign, especially of strangers or of people from different countries or cultures. xen′o·pho′bi·a n. xen′o·pho′bic adj.

xenophobia. [-fō′bē·ə]. Etymology: Gk, xenos + phobos, fear. an anxiety disorder characterized by a pervasive, irrational fear or uneasiness in the presence of strangers, especially foreigners, or in new surroundings. Psychiatry An abnormal/morbid fear of strangers or foreigners. xenophobia (zen´əfō´bēə) , n an anx-iety disorder characterized by a pervasive, irrational fear or uneasiness in the presence of strangers, especially foreigners, or in new surroundings.

Medical Definition of XENOPHOBE. : one unduly fearful of what is foreign and especially of people of foreign origin. — xe·no·pho·bic \ˌze-nə-ˈfō-bik, ˌzē-\ adjective. — xe·no·pho·bi·cal·ly \-bi-k(ə-)lē\ adverb.

xenophobia (zen´əfō´bēə) , n an anx-iety disorder characterized by a pervasive, irrational fear or uneasiness in the presence of strangers, especially foreigners, or in new surroundings. xenophobia. [-fō′bē·ə]. Etymology: Gk, xenos + phobos, fear. an anxiety disorder characterized by a pervasive, irrational fear or uneasiness in the presence of strangers, especially foreigners, or in new surroundings. Psychiatry An abnormal/morbid fear of strangers or foreigner
